intro: Rosa pratensis, commonly known as the meadow rose, is a species of flowering plant in the rose family. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and typically grows in meadows, woodlands, and along streambanks. The plant produces fragrant, pink to white flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it has thorny stems that provide structural support. Rosa pratensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance, supporting pollinators and providing habitat for various insects.
